result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather J Erchul was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defendant to contact probation by 09:00 a.m. on 02-19-2016.
Case 15CT1594 was dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Heather J Erchul in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 3 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
  

Term of Probation:  6 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am. tomorrow (02/19/16).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   
Defendant Heather J Erchul did not appear.   
Case scheduled for 3:30 pm and Matter called @ 3:40 pm.

Court orders a Stayed Warrant to the next court date.
MANDATORY APPEARANCE BY THE DEFENDANT IS REQUIRED OR A WARRANT WILL ISSUED.
  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Heather J Erchul in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Heather J Erchul in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   Defendant Heather J Erchul did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Sonderhouse requests an adjournment.  Court stays the issuance of a warrant until next hearing date.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
